trial_identification.studytitle: Topical timolol maleate gel for non-complicated superficial infantile haemangiomas
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Topical timolol maleate gel for the reduction in colour and size of non-complicated superficial infantile haemangiomas.

interventions.interventions: Timolol maleate gel 0.5% one drop applied to the cutaneous ,small (<5cm), superficial infantile haemangioma twice daily for 24 weeks
interventions.comparator: Emollient lubricant eye drop one drop applied to the cutaneous small (<5cm), superficial infantile haemangioma twice daily for 24 weeks. Placebo chosen as drops feel the same as the active gel.

primaryOutcome.outcome: decrease in red colour scored 0,1,2 both clinically and from photographs
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 1 week,2 weeks,4 weeks,8weeks,12 weeks,16 weeks,20 weeks,24 weeks

secondaryOutcome.outcome: heart rate - with a stethescope measure beats per minute
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 1 week,2 weeks,4 weeks,8 weeks,12 weeks,16 weeks,20 weeks,24 weeks
1 week,2 weeks,4 weeks,8 weeks,12 weeks,16 weeks,20 weeks,24 weeks

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: PHACE syndrome lesions >5cm diametre deep subcutaneous lesions <5 weeks old >24 weeks old

trial_design.concealment: randomisation using adaptive allocation of minimisation to ensure randomisation of subgroups 5-14 weeks and 15-24 weeks. allocation concealment with randomisation will be carried out by the pharmacist with the assistance of the statistician.
trial_design.sequence: pharmacist will phone the statistician with the subgroup age 5-14 weeks versus 15-24 weeks to ensure stratified allocation and the allocation will be generated using permuted block randomisation

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Non-complicated infantile haemangiomas have been followed up with minimal intervention because of spontaneous involution. However the involution phase is slow and most children go to school with a disfiguring infantile haemangioma. Propranolol has been observed to accelerate the involution phase and a small retrospective chart review and a single case report have suggested that topical timolol maleate gel 0.5% may reduce the proliferative phase of smal and superficial infantile haemangiomas with reduced systemic complications.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: SESI NSW Health Northern Hospital network
